bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: on the date the person ceases to be eligible to be enrolled in the drug plan;

change.changenote: Section 30 (3) BEFORE amended by BC Reg 98/2019, effective May 3, 2019.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: A family unit is not eligible to enroll in the MDPO if

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: a private insurer pays any part of the cost of benefits received by a member of the family unit, or
a member of the family unit

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: has been the subject of proceedings to recover a debt due to the government for failing to pay all or part of a monthly instalment, or
owes, at the time of applying to enroll in the MDPO, an amount equalling 3 or more monthly instalments, excluding interest and fees, if any.

change.changenote: Section 31 (1) (a) and (b) BEFORE amended by BC Reg 98/2019, effective May 3, 2019.

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: if the application to enroll in the MDPO is made on or before September 30, beginning the first day of the month that follows the month in which the application was made;
if the application to enroll in the MDPO is made between October 1 and December 31, beginning January 1 of the following year.

change.changenote: Section 32 BEFORE amended by BC Reg 98/2019, effective May 3, 2019.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: A family unit's enrollment in the MDPO ends on the earliest of the following dates:

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: December 31;
if the registrant gives notice to the minister stating the registrant's desire to cancel the enrollment of the registrant's family unit in the MDPO, on the later of

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: the date stated in the notice, if any, and
the date the notice is received by the minister;

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: on the date set by the minister on cancelling the family unit's enrollment in the MDPO.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: The minister may cancel the enrollment of a family unit in the MDPO in any of the following circumstances:

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: if a member of the family unit commits an offence under the Act;
if

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: the minister gives notice to the family unit that family unit owes an amount equalling 3 or more monthly instalments, excluding interest or fees, if any, and
the family unit does not pay the full amount owing within 30 days of the time stated in the notice;

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: if the family unit has failed, as of March 1, to pay an amount owing toward a monthly instalment that

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: was due in the previous year, and

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: A family unit must, immediately on the end of enrollment in the MDPO, pay all amounts, including interest and fees, if any, owing toward monthly instalments.
The total amount that a person is liable to pay under subsection (3) is a debt due to the government and may be

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: deducted from any subsequent payment that may be made to the person under the Act, or
recovered in a court of competent jurisdiction.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: On the end of enrollment in the MDPO, the minister must pay to the person who enrolled a family unit in the MDPO the amount by which the family unit's monthly instalment payments exceeded the cost of benefits paid by the minister under the Act, if that amount is $5 or more.

An eligible person's enrollment in Plan F begins on the date the minister receives notice of the person's eligibility from a director under the Child, Family and Community Service Act that the person is eligible to be enrolled in Plan F.
